Function Documentation

EagleBoolean EagleUtils_CompareWithoutCase ( const char *  s1,
const char *  s2 
)

Compare two strings without case-sensitivity.

If s1 or s2 is NULL then the result will be EagleFalse unless both string are NULL - in which case the result will be EagleTrue.

Parameters:
[in] s1 First string
[in] s2 Second string.
Returns:
EagleTrue is the two strings are the same length and contain the same characters (of any case)

Definition at line 51 of file EagleUtils.c.

00052 {
00053     size_t s1len, i;
00054     
00055     /* if either of the strings is NULL then don't both comparing them, however if they are both NULL then we must
00056      return EagleTrue */
00057     if(NULL == s1 || NULL == s2) {
00058         return (NULL == s1 && NULL == s2);
00059     }
00060     
00061     /* the strings are different lengths, so also don't bother comparing them */
00062     s1len = strlen(s1);
00063     if(strlen(s2) != s1len) {
00064         return EagleFalse;
00065     }
00066     
00067     /* check each character */
00068     for(i = 0; i < s1len; ++i) {
00069         if(tolower(s1[i]) != tolower(s2[i])) {
00070             return EagleFalse;
00071         }
00072     }
00073     
00074     /* the strings must be equal */
00075     return EagleTrue;
00076 }

uint64_t EagleUtils_GetAbsoluteTime ( void   ) 

Get the absolute time.

One second is 1 billion clock ticks.

Returns:
The absolute time of the mocked time.

void EagleUtils_ToLowerCase ( char *  str  ) 

Convert a string to lower case.

This will modify the string parsed in effectivly destorying the original case.

Parameters:
[in,out] str The string.

Variable Documentation

uint64_t EagleUtils_MockAbsoluteTime = 0

If this is not zero then EagleUtils_GetAbsoluteTime() will return this.

You must set this to 0 to return the true absolute time.

Definition at line 9 of file EagleUtils.c.
